intro: Centaurium curvistamineum f. albiflorum, commonly known as the white-flowered centaury, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Gentianaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The most distinctive feature of this variety is its white or pale yellow flowers, which bloom in clusters at the top of the stems. It is native to southern Europe and thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. This plant is often noted for its delicate appearance and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
